title: Public transport for the BBL T20 – Melbourne Renegades v Sydney Thunder: Sunday 18 December 2022
articleContent:
Public transport for the BBL T20 – Melbourne Renegades v Sydney Thunder: Sunday 18 December 2022

It's time for the BBL League to return to Marvel Stadium. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Renegades go into battle with Sydney Thunder. Extra services will help you get home from Marvel Stadium on Sunday 18 December.

The event will begin at 7:15pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Trains arriving Southern Cross before the game, as follows:

  • Craigieburn departing at 5:47pm, arriving on Platform 13
  • Glen Waverley departing at 5:55pm, arriving on Platform 10

Trains depart Southern Cross after the game ends, as follows:

  • Glen Waverley departing at 10:45pm, Platform 10
  • Lilydale departing at 10:58pm, Platform 10
  • Belgrave departing at 10:50pm, Platform 10
  • Dandenong departing at 10:41pm, Platform 12
  • Pakenham departing at 10:47pm, Platform 12
  • Craigieburn departing at 10:40pm, Platform 14

Trains depart Flinders Street after the game ends, as follows:

  • Mernda departing at 10:53pm, Platform 2
  • Hurstbridge departing at 10:59pm, Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Extra trams will operate as Route 30a between East Melbourne and Stop D1 Etihad Stadium via La Trobe Street, and as Route 86a between East Melbourne and Stop D1 Etihad Stadium via Bourke Street.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Marvel Stadium

Customers can catch the following bus routes close to Marvel Stadium:

  • Route 232(Altona North to City)
  • Route 235(Fishermans Bend to City)
  • Route 302(Box Hill to City)
  • Route 304(Doncaster SC to City)
  • Route 905(The Pines SC to City)
  • Route 906(Warrandyte to City)
  • Route 907(Mitcham to City)

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.
articleDescription: Public transport for the BBL T20 – Melbourne Renegades v Sydney Thunder: Sunday 18 December 2022
